headline: Amazon.com (AMZN) Is Up 5.0% After Expanding AI Infrastructure, AWS Backlog and Strategic Partnerships – What's Changed
summary: In recent days, Amazon and its partners have announced a wave of AI- and cloud-focused initiatives spanning AWS infrastructure expansion, new autonomous AI agents, and deeper collaborations such as a potential US$10 billion OpenAI investment and expanded Amazon Luna access on Comcast’s Xfinity devices. Together with a US$200 billion AWS backlog and heavy data center spending, these moves underline how AI-driven workloads are becoming central to Amazon’s long-term profit engine beyond...

content.title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Is Up 5.0% After Expanding AI Infrastructure, AWS Backlog and Strategic Partnerships – What's Changed

Together with a US$200 billion AWS backlog and heavy data center spending, these moves underline how AI-driven workloads are becoming central to Amazon’s long-term profit engine beyond...

headline: How Investors May Respond To Comcast (CMCSA) Saudi Theme Park Plans And New Co-CEO Structure
summary: Earlier in December, Comcast’s Universal Studios entered early-stage planning for a multibillion-dollar theme park in Saudi Arabia while Comcast also filed amended articles of incorporation removing obsolete preferred stock references and completed a network expansion to nearly 22,000 locations in Connecticut’s Litchfield County. The company also announced Michael J. Cavanagh’s appointment as Co-CEO from January 2026 and deepened its cloud gaming and managed services reach through Amazon...

The company also announced Michael J. Cavanagh’s appointment as Co-CEO from January 2026 and deepened its cloud gaming and managed services reach through Amazon...

headline: 12 Days of Christmas? 12 Stocks That Are Gifts for 2026.
summary: Barron’s looked at the  group of stocks and used Wall Street ratings and price targets by sector to find presents for any type of investor.  Nvidia  Amazon, and  Microsoft  shares are loved by the Street, with a Buy rating from more than 90% of the analysts covering them.  The average Buy-rating ratio for stocks in the Russell 1000 is currently about 58%.
